Can you provide a classification of the sentence "Nature is beautiful" in terms of its grammatical parts such as verb, noun, and adjective? 
To aid in the classification process, the sentence can be represented in a table as follows:
| Part of Speech | Word |
| --- | --- |
| Noun | Nature |
| Verb | is |
| Adjective | beautiful | 
Based on this table, what is the classification of the sentence?

Certainly! The sentence "Nature is beautiful" can be broken down into its grammatical parts as follows:

| Part of Speech | Word      |
|----------------|-----------|
| Noun           | Nature    |
| Verb           | is        |
| Adjective      | beautiful |

This classification shows that "Nature" functions as a noun, "is" serves as the verb (specifically a linking verb), and "beautiful" acts as the adjective describing "Nature."
